channel.title: Starting a Server From the beginning [ Help ]
channel.description:
[b]Hey guys , im just new but i just got into the rsps thingy and i hoped somone could help me i searched everywhere for a full guide so here are my questions:
I want to get a own RSPS , So i downloaded the Explicity Release and i could play but on 127.0.0.1 (local host ) i want to play together with friends:
- How Can i share the webclient or downloadable client with friends so they can play with me? - Where and what ip do i have to fill in and where? - how can i edit files like : shops / stores ect.? - What JDK do i need and where can i edit that into my server
i don't know allot from rsps but i can do things with my computer any help is apriciated and don't post any nonsess post like : " i don't know either man sorry " because that doesn't help me at all
Thanks :)[/b]

@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

change all 127.0.0.1’s to your no-ip

Read full topic

the ip 1 or 2 to my ip?

item.title: Starting a Server From the beginning [ Help ]
item.dc:creator: @Clarity Clarity
item.description:
@Clarity wrote:

i got in the : " Client.java " file , two ip addresses which one do i need to change to my own which i got from : www.whatismyip.com

the two ip adresses:
1=

if ((j == 13 || j == 10) && inputString.length() > 0) {
if (myPrivilege == 2 || server.equals(“127.0.0.1”)
|| 1 == 1/* to remove */) {

2=
public static String server = “127.0.0.1”;

help please

Read full topic
item.source: Starting a Server From the beginning [ Help ]

item.title: Starting a Server From the beginning [ Help ]
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“Clarity, post:4, topic:483874”][quote author=fpsnipmob link=topic=602110.msg4220445#msg4220445 date=1360712194]
Well i can help a little…

You make a copy of your client, one having the ip stay as local host, and move it to the side, as thats YOUR client.
Take the copy and changed the ip to your ip, so others can connect. that one wont work for you, but it will for others

The client ip should be in Client.java

Any JDK is fine, but i recommend getting the most recent.
[/quote]

you said: change the ip to your ip , but which one? the ip4 or the ip i get if i got to whatismyip.com[/quote]
Did you already downloaded No-ip? No? go to no-ip.com, register, download the client, add a host before you download it
did you portforwarded? No? Aight, go to 192.168.1.1 and then portforward 43594 with TCP and again with UDP
Then allow your Ports at Firewall ( Much guides out there )
Bam You done, now just change the ip from the client and congratulations then!

Read full topic
item.source: Starting a Server From the beginning [ Help ]

item.title: Starting a Server From the beginning [ Help ]
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I advise you to learn some Java. If you want to connect to the server when you’re hosting it on your computer, use the IP: 127.0.0.1, which is localhost.

Edit: If you want other players to play your server, it’d be simplest to just to make another client folder and have the IP for that client as your IP or no-ip.

Read full topic
item.source: Starting a Server From the beginning [ Help ]

@fpsnipmob wrote:

Well i can help a little…

You make a copy of your client, one having the ip stay as local host, and move it to the side, as thats YOUR client.
Take the copy and changed the ip to your ip, so others can connect. that one wont work for you, but it will for others

The client ip should be in Client.java

Any JDK is fine, but i recommend getting the most recent.
